001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.regimes;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.StaticFactory;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.common.utils.Pair;
006import net.tvburger.jdl.model.DataSet;
007import net.tvburger.jdl.model.EstimationFunction;
008import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.ObjectiveFunction;
009import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.Optimizer;
010import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.Regime;
011
012import java.util.List;
013
014/**
015 * A {@link Regime} decorator that wraps another training regime and reports the
016 * objective (loss) value at each epoch.
017 * <p>
018 * This class is typically used for debugging or monitoring: it computes the
019 * aggregated loss before the first epoch (baseline) and after each epoch, then
020 * prints the results if {@code dump} is enabled. It also tracks the relative
021 * improvement between epochs.
022 * </p>
023 * <h3>Improvement Sign Convention</h3>
024 * The reported relative improvement is expressed as a percentage change in
025 * loss compared to the previous epoch:
026 * <ul>
027 *   <li>A negative value means the loss decreased (improved).</li>
028 *   <li>A positive value means the loss increased (worsened).</li>
029 * </ul>
030 * <h3>Thread Safety</h3>
031 * This class is not thread-safe. Create a new instance per training run or call
032 * {@link #reset()} if you want to reuse the same instance across runs.
033 *
034 * @see DelegatedRegime
035 */
036@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
037public class ObjectiveReportingRegime extends DelegatedRegime {
038
039    /**
040     * The hyperparameter name to dump the objective
041     */
042    public static final String HP_OBJECTIVE_DUMP = "objectiveDump";
043
044    private Float improvement;
045    private Float currentLoss;
046    private int iteration;
047
048    /**
049     * Creates a new reporting regime that wraps the given regime.
050     *
051     * @param regime the underlying training regime to delegate to
052     */
053    @StaticFactory
054    public static ObjectiveReportingRegime create(Regime regime) {
055        return new ObjectiveReportingRegime(regime, false);
056    }
057
058    /**
059     * Creates a new reporting regime that wraps the given regime.
060     *
061     * @param regime the underlying training regime to delegate to
062     * @param dump   whether to print loss values and improvement at each epoch
063     */
064    public ObjectiveReportingRegime(Regime regime, boolean dump) {
065        super(regime);
066        setHyperparameter(HP_OBJECTIVE_DUMP, dump);
067    }
068
069    /**
070     * Returns whether this regime is currently printing loss values.
071     *
072     * @return {@code true} if reporting is enabled, {@code false} otherwise
073     */
074    public boolean isDumpingLossValues() {
075        return getHyperparameter(HP_OBJECTIVE_DUMP, Boolean.class);
076    }
077
078    /**
079     * Enables or disables reporting of loss values.
080     *
081     * @param dump {@code true} to enable reporting, {@code false} to disable
082     */
083    public void setDumpingLossValues(boolean dump) {
084        setHyperparameter(HP_OBJECTIVE_DUMP, dump);
085    }
086
087    /**
088     * Trains the given estimation function using the wrapped regime and reports
089     * the aggregated loss before and after training.
090     * <p>
091     * On the first epoch, the baseline aggregated loss is computed before any
092     * updates. After each epoch, the new aggregated loss is computed, the
093     * relative improvement is calculated, and results are printed if reporting
094     * is enabled.
095     * </p>
096     *
097     * @param estimationFunction the model to train
098     * @param trainingSet        the dataset to train on
099     * @param objective          the loss function to evaluate
100     * @param optimizer          the optimizer to update parameters
101     * @param <E>                the type of estimation function
102     */
103    @Override
104    public <E extends EstimationFunction<Float>> void train(E estimationFunction, DataSet<Float> trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction objective, Optimizer<? super E, Float> optimizer) {
105        Float previousLoss;
106        if (objective != null && iteration == 0) {
107            List<Pair<Float[], Float[]>> batch = trainingSet.samples().stream().map(s -> Pair.of(estimationFunction.estimate(s.features()), s.targetOutputs())).toList();
108            previousLoss = objective.calculateLoss(batch);
109            if (isDumpingLossValues()) {
110                System.out.printf("[Measurement %4d] Aggregated loss = %.4f (baseline)%n", iteration, previousLoss);
111            }
112        } else {
113            previousLoss = currentLoss;
114        }
115        iteration++;
116        regime.train(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective, optimizer);
117        if (objective != null) {
118            List<Pair<Float[], Float[]>> batch = trainingSet.samples().stream().map(s -> Pair.of(estimationFunction.estimate(s.features()), s.targetOutputs())).toList();
119            currentLoss = objective.calculateLoss(batch);
120            improvement = (previousLoss - currentLoss) / previousLoss * -100f;
121            if (isDumpingLossValues()) {
122                System.out.printf("[Measurement %4d] Aggregated loss = %.4f (%.2f%%)%n", iteration, currentLoss, improvement);
123            }
124        }
125    }
126
127    /**
128     * Returns the relative improvement in aggregated loss compared to the
129     * previous epoch.
130     * <p>
131     * For example, if epoch N yields a loss of 10 and epoch N+1 yields a loss
132     * of 5, this method returns -50.0f. If the loss increases, the returned
133     * value will be positive.
134     * </p>
135     *
136     * @return the relative improvement percentage, or {@code null} if no
137     * training has happened yet
138     */
139    public Float getRelativeImprovement() {
140        return improvement;
141    }
142
143    /**
144     * Returns the aggregated loss from the most recent epoch.
145     *
146     * @return the last aggregated loss value, or {@code null} if no training
147     * has happened yet
148     */
149    public Float getCurrentLoss() {
150        return currentLoss;
151    }
152
153    /**
154     * Resets this reporting regime so it can be reused for a new training runs.
155     * This clears the iteration count, current loss, and improvement history.
156     */
157    public void reset() {
158        this.iteration = 0;
159        this.currentLoss = null;
160        this.improvement = null;
161    }
162}
